alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 7:48AM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Pangborn Airport, Mansfield, Ritzville, Waterville, Wenatchee, Badger Mountain Road, Chelan, Creston, Coulee City, Number 1 Canyon, Cashmere, Number 2 Canyon, Entiat, Harrington, Wilbur, Grand Coulee, and Odessa. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
